case_title: Jahangir Khan vs The State through Prosecutor General Balochistan
respondant: The State through Prosecutor General Balochistan
respondent: The State through Prosecutor General Balochistan

accussed_details.name: Jahangir Khan
allegation: Dishonestly receiving stolen property in the commission of a dacoity

complaint_summary: FIR No.08/2020 was lodged by Mehboob Ali SI under Section 412, P.P.C., alleging that Jahangir Khan and others were found in possession of a stolen Toyota vehicle during snap checking on Nari Bridge, Sibi. The vehicle was reportedly stolen from Gulistan-e-Johar East Karachi, linked to FIR No.443/2019 under Section 392/34, P.P.C.

factual_summary.allegations: Toyota vehicle intercepted with six persons, including armed individuals and possession of stolen vehicle linked to FIR No. 443/2019 under Section 392/34, P.P.C.

investigation_summary: Police intercepted a Toyota vehicle with six occupants, including Jahangir Khan, who claimed to be a Major in Pak Army. The vehicle was identified as stolen, and the accused were charged under Section 412, P.P.C. Further investigation revealed no direct evidence proving Jahangir Khan's knowledge of the vehicle's use in dacoity.

key_points: Section 412, P.P.C. requires knowledge of stolen property linked to dacoity.
Mere possession of stolen vehicle does not attract Section 412, P.P.C.
Trial court empowered to alter charges under Section 227, Cr.P.C.
Concurrent jurisdiction demands trial by inferior court where applicable.
precedents_cited: Muhammad Jameel Azeem v. Ghulam Shabeer 2011 SCMR 1145
Nadir Shah v. The State 1980 SCMR 402
Malik Zafar Yousaf v. State PLD 2002 Lah 84
judgment_summary.summary: The High Court set aside the Sessions Judge's order dated 18.11.2020, altered the charge from Section 412, P.P.C. to Section 411, P.P.C., and directed the case to be transferred to the Judicial Magistrate for trial. The court emphasized the need for evidence proving the accused's knowledge of the vehicle's involvement in a crime.

Decision_or_verdict: Case Transferred to Judicial Magistrate; Charge altered to Section 411, P.P.C.

final_order.instructions: Case file transferred to Judicial Magistrate for trial under Section 411, P.P.C.

legal_arguments: Section 412, P.P.C. requires proof of knowledge that the stolen property was used in dacoity.
Section 227, Cr.P.C. allows alteration of charges at any stage before judgment.
Concurrent jurisdiction demands cases be tried by courts of inferior jurisdiction when applicable.
citations: Muhammad Jameel Azeem v. Ghulam Shabeer 2011 SCMR 1145
Nadir Shah v. The State 1980 SCMR 402
Machia and 2 others v. The State PLD 1976 SC 695
Shahadat Khan v. Home Secretary to the Government of West Pakistan PLD 1969 SC 158
Malik Zafar Yousaf v. State PLD 2002 Lah 84

witness_statement.Mehboob Ali SI: Reported interception of stolen vehicle and identification of occupants, including Jahangir Khan, during snap checking.

key_issues: Whether the accused had knowledge of the vehicle's involvement in dacoity.
Applicability of Section 412, P.P.C. versus Section 411, P.P.C.

maxims.Functus Officio: Once a court forwards a challan, it cannot act further in the matter.

legal_terms.Dishonestly Receiving Stolen Property: Possession of stolen property with knowledge of its criminal origin.
legal_terms.Concurrent Jurisdiction: Authority shared by two courts to hear a case.

words_and_phrases.Alteration of Charge: Modification of charges against the accused during trial.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around the possession of a stolen vehicle allegedly linked to dacoity. The High Court emphasized the need for evidence proving the accused's knowledge of the vehicle's criminal use and transferred the case to the Judicial Magistrate with altered charges under Section 411, P.P.C.
